{"rule":"CAPITALIZATION_NNP_DERIVED","sentence":"^\\QPuppe discovered triangulated categories while looking at the stable homotopy category, while Verdier and Grothendieck were motivated from a more algebraic viewpoint by the derived category of an abelian category.\\E$"}
{"rule":"CAPITALIZATION_NNP_DERIVED","sentence":"^\\QTypical algebraic examples of triangulated categories are: the derived categories of abelian category as mentioned above, the stable module category, as well as the homotopy category of chain complexes.\\E$"}
